item.name: Design and Build Database Tables
item.description: Learn how to create a database connection, diagram database objects, and generate database objects.

item.name: Connect to a Database
item.description: Define connections in the Connection Navigator to live databases in order to create, edit, and use database objects.

item.name: Browse Online Databases
item.description: View schemas and the objects they contain via a JDBC connection to an online database.

item.name: Browse Offline Databases and Schemas
item.description: Browse offline schemas in the navigator to find objects such as offline tables or view.

item.name: Edit Table Data
item.description: Change the value in a single cell, add and delete rows, and commit the changes to the database.

item.name: Create Database Tables
item.description: Use a wizard to create a table through a database connection.

item.name: Create PL/SQL Functions, Procedures, Packages, and Triggers
item.description: Create PL/SQL functions, procedures, packages and triggers directly in a database from the Connection Navigator.

item.name: Create Offline PL/SQL Functions, Procedures, and Packages
item.description: Create an offline definition of a PL/SQL package, function, or procedure in the Application Navigator.

item.name: Create a Database Diagram
item.description: Create a diagram on which to graphically model offline tables and foreign key relationships, views, synonyms and sequences.
